titles: Anglorum lacrimæ in a sad passion complayning the death of our late soueraigne Lady Queene Elizabeth: yet comforted againe by the vertuous hopes of our most royall and renowned King Iames: whose Maiestie God long continue.
Celestiall elegies of the goddesses and the Muses
author: Rogers, Thomas, 1573 or 4-1609 or 10.
Johnson, Richard, 1573-1659?
publisher: [By W. White] for T. Pauier, and are to be solde at the signe of the Catte and Parrets neare the Exchange,
notes: Plagiarized, by Richard Johnson, from STC 21225: Rogers, Thomas.  Celestiall elegies of the goddesses and the Muses.
Reproduction of the original in the Bodleian Library.
keywords: Elizabeth --  I, --  Queen of England, 1533-1603 --  Poetry --  Early works to 1800.
